FYI Bart, Heritrix doesn't use log4j. It uses the 'native' 
java.util.logging package.
St.Ack


Bart Kiers wrote:
>
> Hi Natalia,
>
> I am not aware of such functionality within Heritrix. Perhaps you can 
> change log4j
>
> (the logging tool Heritrix uses) in such a way that it writes all that 
> information into
>
> a database. You might want to Google on the words �/Log4j 
> JDBCAppender/�. And/or
>
> visit log4j�s website 
> (http://logging.apache.org/log4j/docs/documentation.html 
> <http://logging.apache.org/log4j/docs/documentation.html>) for
>
> more information.
>
> Good luck.
>
> Kind regards,
>
> Bart Kiers.
>
> ------------------------------------------------------------------------
>
> *Van:* archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com

> *Verzonden:* Tuesday, October 17, 2006 11:17 AM

> *Onderwerp:* Re: [archive-crawler] General statistics
>
> Thanks Barts,
>
> I know about the information about each jop separatly, but I want to
> work with all this files at the same time.
> I want to make full reports and statics including the information of all
> crawled jobs as one.
>
> I need data like:
>
> Total Jobs Crawled: 25
> Total Seeds Crawled: 150
> Total Seeds Crawled from Job1: 150
> Total Seeds Crawled from Job2: 150
> ....
> Total Hosts Crawled: 18
> Total Hosts Crawled from Job1: 18
> Total Hosts Crawled from Job12: 18
> ...
> Total Documents Crawled: 889
> Total Documents Crawled from Job1: 8
> Total Documents Crawled from Job2: 58
> ....
>
> Total Raw Data Size in Bytes: 34829016 (33 MB)
> Total Raw Data Size in Bytes from Job1: 3 (xx MB)
> Total Raw Data Size in Bytes from Job2: 16 (xx MB)
> .....
>
> and show some graphs
>
> Natalia
>
